text:
News Releases

Payroll employment rises by 236,000 in March; unemployment rate changes little at 3.5% Total nonfarm payroll employment rose by 236,000 in March, and the unemployment rate changed little at 3.5 percent. Employment continued to trend up in leisure and hospitality, government, professional and business services, and health care.

| | |

Real average hourly earnings for all employees decrease 0.1% in February Real average hourly earnings for all employees decreased 0.1 percent in February, seasonally adjusted. Average hourly earnings increased 0.2 percent, and CPI-U increased 0.4 percent. Real average weekly earnings decreased 0.4 percent.

| |

Next Release

The Employment Situation for April 2023 is scheduled to be released on May 5, 2023, at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time.

Real Earnings for March 2023 is scheduled to be released on April 12, 2023, at 8:30 A.M. Eastern Time.
title: CES (National) : U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics
